course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Qualitative Health Research
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 19 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course explores qualitative methodologies used in health research and principles for responsible and ethical research conduct. Topics included are theory's role in research., research ethics, research design, and key qualitative methods employed in research on human health. Here, students will engage in interactive discussions, case studies, and practical exercises to reinforce their understanding of qualitative research methodologies and ethical considerations in health research. In this course, students will delve into qualitative methodologies employed in health research while emphasizing responsible and ethical research conduct. Students will gain comprehensive insights into the role of theory in qualitative health research, research ethics, research design, and key qualitative methods applied to study human health. Throughout the course, students will critically reflect on challenges and dilemmas that may arise in qualitative health research and explore the ethical principles governing data collection, analysis, and dissemination.
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
sections: Class Nbr: 2602, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: A. Fitzroy, Status: Open
